column4: Hi, is there any way to copy the contents of the ubuntu-6.10-server-i386.iso to a usb thumbdrive and boot from that instead of a cd? does anyone have a link with a howto?
I think that option is only avail with a live distro, and you actually boot off the cd but the thumb drive contains your configs and such.  casper-cow or something
my server pc doesn't have any cd drive though, that's why I need to boot from the usb thumbdrive
there is a debian installer that installs ubuntu from windows, a net install, they claim its a ubuntu derivitive
